feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 2:03PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: .Warm temperatures have caused ice movement across parts of the Kuskokwim Basin. This has resulted in swiftly moving ice jams and flooding of nearby areas from ice action. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 3:22AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Sea Levels Sunday Night Through Tuesday... Water levels continue to rise along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik west. The highest water levels are expected to occur Monday Night and Tuesday morning. Water may push up on top of the sea ice, and could cause ice to pile up on beaches from Utqiagvik west. No infrastructure flooding is expected at this time.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 6:49PM CST until December 08 at 8:15AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Paint Rock River near Woodville affecting Jackson, Marshall and Madison Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING...
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson; Madison; Marshall

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 8:40PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage. It is forecast to continue a very slow fall while remaining within Minor Flood stage for the foreseeable future. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Minor flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia
